required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility and Safety Study of Nivolumab With Irinotecan for Small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I Feasibility and Safety Study of Nivolumab in Combination With Irinotecan in Relapsed or Refractory Small Cell Lung Cancer (SCLC) Followed by Maintenance Nivolumab

brief_summary.textblock: This study will determine the frequency of adverse events (side effects) in patients with relapsed or refractory small cell lung cancer (SCLC) when given nivolumab and irinotecan together followed by nivolumab maintenance. This study will test the safety of the study treatments when given together and see what effect (good or bad) it has on participants and their cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the frequency and severity of adverse events in patients with small cell lung cancer after receiving nivolumab plus irinotecan followed by nivolumab maintenance.
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: CTCAE v.4.0. Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v4.0.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: PFS as measured from start of therapy till disease progression.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year.
secondary_outcome.description: OS as measured from start of therapy till date of death or last follow up assessment.

arm_group.description: Drug: Nivolumab 360mg IV Day 1 of each 21 day cycle until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity + Drug: Irinotecan 500mg IV Day of each 21 day cycle for 2 cycles Followed by maintenance nivolumab (without irinotecan)

intervention.description: PD-1 inhibitor approved by the US FDA for treatment of patients with lung cancer.
Chemotherapy drug currently FDA approved for treatment of multiple tumors, including small cell lung cancer.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed SCLC with known UGT1A genotype.
- Patients who have received at least 1 prior platinum-based chemotherapy.
- Life expectancy of 3 months or more.
- Measurable disease.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with UGT1A polymorphism.
- Currently receiving chemotherapy.
- Pregnant and nursing women.

facility.name: Georgia Cancer Center at AU Medical Center

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor, Hematology/Oncology, Director of Thoracic Oncology and Phase I Program
